name: 5-(4-morpholinyl)-2-nitrophenol
Reason: 5-(4-morpholinyl)-2-nitrophenol has a melting point that we can analyze by considering its structural components. The basic unit for comparison is 2-nitrophenol, which has a melting point of around 106°C. The morpholinyl group (4-morpholinyl) adds rigidity and molecular weight, estimated at around +20°C. The nitro group introduces a dipole, increasing intermolecular forces and melting point, estimated at around +10°C. The ether linkage (–O–) reduces the melting point due to reduced hydrogen bonding, estimated at around -5°C. The nitro group also introduces a dipole, which can participate in hydrogen bonding, estimated at around +5°C.
